00027 #include <GisCommon.h>
00028 #include <common/Collection.h>
00029 #include <common/Dimensionality.h>
00030 /// \brief
00031 /// The GisIDirectPosition class is a direct position object.  
00032 /// GisIDirectPosition is a simple coordinate position in any allowed dimension.  
00033 /// The actual object may have several implementations, depending on
00034 /// the dimension and other factors.
00035 /// This is a lightweight helper type for Geometries in the Geometry package.
00036 /// \note
00037 /// It does not derive from IGeometry.
00038 class GisIDirectPosition : public GisIDisposable
00039 {
00040 public:
00041 
00042 
00043     /// \brief
00044     /// Gets the X ordinate.
00045     /// 
00046     /// \return
00047     /// Returns the X ordinate; default is numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN()
00048     /// 
00049     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetX() const = 0;
00050     
00051     /// \brief
00052     /// Gets the Y ordinate.
00053     /// 
00054     /// \return
00055     /// Returns the Y ordinate; default is numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN()
00056     /// 
00057     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetY() const = 0;
00058     
00059     /// \brief
00060     /// Gets the Z ordinate.
00061     /// 
00062     /// \return
00063     /// Returns the Z ordinate; default is numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN()
00064     /// 
00065     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetZ() const = 0;
00066 
00067     /// \brief
00068     /// Gets the M ordinate.
00069     /// 
00070     /// \return
00071     /// Returns the M ordinate; default is numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN()
00072     /// 
00073     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetM() const = 0;
00074 
00075     /// \brief
00076     /// Gets the ordinates as an array.
00077     /// 
00078     /// \remarks
00079     /// The caller must not free the returned array.
00080     /// The ordinates are in the order XYZM, with only those present 
00081     /// according to the dimensionality.
00082     /// 
00083     /// \return
00084     /// Returns the ordinates
00085     /// 
00086     GISGEOM_API virtual const double * GetOrdinates() = 0;
00087 
00088     /// \brief
00089     /// Gets the dimensionality of ordinates in this position.
00090     /// 
00091     /// \remarks
00092     ///  Values are from the GisDimensionality enumeration.
00093     /// A return type of "GisInt32" is used instead of the enumeration, catering to typical use with bit masking.
00094     /// 
00095     /// \return
00096     /// Returns the ordinate dimensionality
00097     /// 
00098     GISGEOM_API virtual GisInt32 GetDimensionality() const = 0;
00099 
00100 protected:
00101 
00102     /// \brief
00103     /// Constructs a default instance.
00104     /// 
00105     /// \return
00106     /// Returns nothing
00107     /// 
00108     GISGEOM_API GisIDirectPosition() {};
00109 
00110     /// \brief
00111     /// Default destructor.
00112     /// 
00113     /// \return
00114     /// Returns nothing
00115     /// 
00116     GISGEOM_API virtual ~GisIDirectPosition() {};
00117 };
00118 
00119 
00120 /// \brief
00121 ///  The GisDirectPositionCollection class is a collection of DirectPosition objects.
00122 class GisDirectPositionCollection : public GisCollection<GisIDirectPosition, GisException>
00123 {
00124 public:
00125     /// \brief
00126     ///  Creates an instance of GisDirectPositionCollection with no contained elements.
00127     /// 
00128     /// \return
00129     /// Returns an empty collection
00130     /// 
00131     static GisDirectPositionCollection* Create()
00132     {
00133         GisDirectPositionCollection* value = new GisDirectPositionCollection();
00134         if (NULL == value)
00135             throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_1_BADALLOC)));
00136 
00137         return value;
00138     }
00139 
00140 protected:
00141     void Dispose()
00142     {
00143         delete this;
00144     }
00145 };
